text.0: we call thee lord and leader of the heavenly hosts the wise among the wise the famousest of all.
text.1: the king supreme of prayers o brahmaṇaspati hear us with help sit down in place of sacrifice.
text.2: bṛhaspati god immortal verily the gods have gained from thee the wise a share in holy rites.
text.3: as with great light the sun brings forth the rays of morn so thou alone art father of all sacred prayer.
text.4: when thou hast chased away revilers and the gloom thou mountest the refulgent car of sacrifice.
text.5: the awful car bṛhaspati that quells the foe slays demons cleaves the stall of kine and finds the light.
text.6: thou leadest with good guidance and preservest men distress oertakes not him who offers gifts to thee.
text.7: him who hates prayer thou punishest bṛhaspati quelling his wrath herein is thy great mightiness.
text.8: no sorrow no distress from any side no foes no creatures doubletongued have overcome the man.
text.9: thou drivest all seductive fiends away from him whom careful guard thou keepest brahmaṇaspati.
text.10: thou art our keeper wise preparer of our paths we for thy service sing to thee with hymns of praise.
text.11: bṛhaspati whoever lays a snare for us him may his evil fate precipitate destroy.
text.12: him too who threatens us without offence of ours the evilminded arrogant rapacious man.
text.13: him turn thou from our path away bṛhaspati give us fair access to this banquet of the gods.
text.14: thee as protector of our bodies we invoke thee saviour as the comforter who loveth us.
text.15: strike o bṛhaspati the gods revilers down and let not the unrighteous come to highest bliss.
text.16: through thee kind prosperer o brahmaṇaspati may we obtain the wealth of men which all desire.
text.17: and all our enemies who near or far away prevail against us crush and leave them destitute.
text.18: with thee as our own rich and liberal ally may we bṛhaspati gain highest power of life.
text.19: let not the guileful wicked man be lord of usstill may we prosper singing goodly hymns of praise.
text.20: strong never yielding hastening to the battlecry consumer of the foe victorious in the strife.
text.21: thou art sins true avenger brahmaṇaspati who tamest een the fierce the wildly passionate.
text.22: whoso with mind ungodly seeks to do us harm who deeming him a man of might mid lords would slay.
text.23: let not his deadly blow reach us bṛhaspati may we humiliate the strong illdoers wrath.
text.24: the mover mid the spoil the winner of all wealth to be invoked in fight and reverently adored.
text.25: bṛhaspati hath overthrown like cars of war all wicked enemies who fain would injure us.
text.26: burn up the demons with thy fiercest flaming brand those who have scorned thee in thy manifested might.
text.27: show forth that power that shall deserve the hymn of praise destroy the evil speakers o bṛhaspati.
text.28: bṛhaspati that which the foe deserves not which shines among the folk effectual splendid.
text.29: that son of law i which is with might refulgentthat treasure wonderful bestow thou on us.
text.30: give us not up to those who foes in ambuscade are greedy for the wealth of him who sits at ease.
text.31: who cherish in their heart abandonment of gods bṛhaspati no further rest shall they obtain.
text.32: for tvaṣṭar he who knows each sacred song brought thee to life preeminent oer all the things that be.
text.33: guiltscourger guiltavenger is bṛhaspati who slays the spoiler and upholds the mighty law.
text.34: the mountain for thy glory cleft itself apart when aṅgiras thou openedst the stall of kine.
text.35: thou o bṛhaspati with indra for ally didst hurl down waterfloods which gloom had compassed round.
text.36: o brahmaṇaspati be thou controller of this our hymn and prosper thou our children.
text.37: all that the gods regard with love is blessed loud may we speak with heroes in assembly.
